html:
Etymology 1[edit]

From re- +‎ cadō (“fall”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /ˈre.ki.doː/, [ˈrɛ.kɪ.d̪oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /ˈre.t͡ʃi.do/, [ˈrɛː.t͡ʃi.d̪ɔ]

Verb[edit]

recidō (present infinitive recidere, perfect active reccidī or recidī, supine recāsum); third conjugation

  1. I fall back, return (especially of an evil).
  2. I recoil.
  3. I fall upon, happen to.

Derived terms[edit]
  • recidīvus

Etymology 2[edit]

From re- +‎ caedō (“cut, hew”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /reˈkiː.doː/, [rɛˈkiː.d̪oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /reˈt͡ʃi.do/, [rɛˈt͡ʃiː.d̪ɔ]

Verb[edit]

recīdō (present infinitive recīdere, perfect active recīdī, supine recīsum); third conjugation

  1. I cut back, cut off.
  2. I abridge, cut short.
